name: Hotel Tagoo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 7 night break at Hotel Tagoo where we stayed in room 20 which was kept immaculately clean and had fantastic views from what seemed like to top of the world. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in - either that or the walk back up the hill at night wiped us out ;o). Breakfast was excellent, far above what you would expect from a 2* budget hotel. We enjoyed relaxing in the reception area/lounge after breakfast watching the cruise ships arrive at the island while Anna worked exceptionally hard in the background, ensuring everyone was prepared for their days adventures on the island.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, fantastic views

reviews.text: Anna dealt with any queries we had immediately and her husband was kind enough to give us a lift to the airport to pick up our hire car the day after we arrived. (We had originally been told by the hire company that they were based in town, which was not the case)
reviews.title: Hotel Tagoo-a little bit of paradise, the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We partied on Paradise and Super Paradise beach and snorkeled in the crystal clear waters of the virgin beaches north of the town. Meals were reasonable if you shopped around, especially in the beach tavernas of Paradise and Super Paradise however my favourite hang out was in Little Venice where we got to meet some very interesting people...
reviews.title: Perfect start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: Anna was aware that our children had gone to Ibiza for 3 weeks with their grandparents and enquired after them on a daily basis. The free high speed internet access and free use of the PC allowed us to keep in touch with them.
reviews.title: Friendly, fun, beautiful hotel in Greece

reviews.text: We plan to return with our extended family next year and look forward to using the new jacuzzi that Anna plans to install over the winter.
reviews.title: oh my gosh, am i dreaming?!

reviews.text: This is the best ( budget ) hotel we ever had.
reviews.title: the place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ten minutes walk ( road down )to Mykonos center , but 15 min walk back to the hotel ( road up ).
reviews.title: Loved the sea views

likes.liked: — Sea views, pool and Mykons white cube buildings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very clean rooms , ( every day cleaning and clean towels )
reviews.title: Hotel Tagoo is what you've been surfing for!

likes.liked: — The views are to die for and the staff fantastic

reviews.text: every room has his own balcony or terras , with view over sea .
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel and Stay

reviews.text: very nice staf, who will do everything for you.
reviews.title: Magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is beautiful hotel with very friendly Hotel owner, Anna. She just like my family and give all the great suggestion, including excellent restaurants. We have a welcome ouzo drink when arrived. I love the Greek Night that she organized and learn my first Greek Dance. I have so much fun when stay in this hotel. They also paint the hotel white every year. It is really a lovely hotel!!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great great hotel... We came during the second week of August and absolutely loved staying there. It is not the first time we came to Mykonos but we had neve experienced such a good hotel.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.text: Everything is perfect from the moment you take the free shuttle bus at the airport with Yannis... The first impression on the hotel is like paradise with this wonderful view from the swimming pool. Then you meet Anna, the owner of the hotel, who has such a great sense of hospitality: she is always very nice, giving you many very interesting tips on the island, restaurants, beaches... she is really a very nice person and she is in fact really commited to the success of your trip in Mykonos. It is so rare to find such a quality of service and humanity in hotels (especially in the hotels we tried before in Mykonos).
reviews.title: Beautiful view, friendly hosts, good location--PERFECT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What else? The rooms are nice and clean, the hotel is not far from the town, you have wonderful sunsets, the bar is great (with Anna's brother, Jimmy who's reallu cool too, and sometimes also Anna's son)....
reviews.title: The only plae to stay in Mykonos

reviews.text: Definitely the place to be in Mykonos!
reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Tagoo August 12-17 in the height of summer. The moment i found this hotel in my internet searches I could not look any further and I was not disappointed! I have stayed in many hotels all around the world from hostels to high end hotels in Dubai... and this is by far my most memorable experience. Perfect location with breath taking views of the bay and picture perfect sunsets while you have sundowners at the pool bar. Anna is incredible and immediately treated me like her long lost son, worrying about me on the scooters, making sure I make the right choices for beaches, sightseeing, bars and restaurants! I actually miss her!! I stayed 6 days and it was not long enough so I will be going back for sure! Ten minute walk to town, rooms clean, cute and quiet, friendly atmosphere suited for everyone. If you're lucky enough to be there for Greek night it is a lot of fun and all the guests mingle together. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Mykonos, Hotel Tagoo is the place to be! Perfection! Thank you Anna and family! I'll be back!! :)
reviews.title: Words Cannot Describe!

reviews.text: Hotel tagoo was amazing. Family-runned hotel. Nothing budget about this hotel. They made you feel like you were in a 5-star hotel. All hotel staff is family and very very friendly. Hotel only 10 minute walk to city center where all the parties, restaurants, and shops are.
reviews.title: amazing hospitality

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel three times now. Sorry for the long review....but this hotel deserves it.
reviews.title: Simple, Savvy, Mediterranean Elegance.

reviews.text: I travel often for work (I'm a flight attendant---so tons of hotel stays every week). I have NEVER had a problem with anything. The people who will enjoy this hotel the most are savvy travelers and travelers who have done their homework.
reviews.title: perfect !

reviews.text: You can review my previous reviews and there were changes to the hotel this year but they were ALL positive. This year a perfect covered area was added to the pool. It is great and usually you can have hours to yourself with a million dollar view (great for if you want to go to the pool but want a little bit of alone time). Umbrella's also added to the pool adding a great ambience. The rooms are VERY clean (beds are great as well--slept well EVERY night) and provide a simple elegant place to relax after beaches, nightclubs, or shopping. Another great addition are sitting areas outside of EVERY room. This is great to enjoy a drink, read, or just relax if you want some "me time". Also, free WIFI added and it is so easy to connect using your IPhone or computer in lobby or pool area.
reviews.title: Amazing Time - Suited our every need

reviews.text: I discovered this very special hotel on Tripadvisor, and it lived up to our expectations in every way.
reviews.title: fantastic oasis

likes.disliked: — that our stay was too short !

reviews.text: Our holiday began in Santorini (Santorini Princess), and we then headed off to our next stop, Mykonos, at Hotel Tagoo. Mykonos is wild, busy and exciting! The port was hectic, and we were more than pleased to see Yiannis there waiting to take us up to the hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel Tagoo- Best deal on Mykonos

likes.liked: — The friendliness of Anna and her family.
likes.disliked: — the bed was a little too firm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anna quickly filled us in on the basics, with a map clearly marking out the buses, taxis, beaches and other places of interest. Our room was large and clean, had a lovely sea/sunset view, and we had the added surprise of breakfast included in the price. it was a pleasure to come 'home' to our beautiful white oasis, just a short walk from town centre, each evening.
reviews.title: Best hotel in mykonos

likes.liked: — the pool, anna, the views, the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to Anna for helping us plan our days and suggesting such great places to visit and eat, Yiannis for fetching us at the port and taking us back to the airport (at no extra charge!), Camille and Jimmy for our cocktails and chats at the pool, and Tripadvisor for helping me find this hotel which I'm sure is one-of-a-kind for personalised service in Europe.
reviews.title: Fun in the Sun!!

likes.liked: — Great value, fun & friendly staff, great view, great pool.

reviews.text: We can't wait to return !
reviews.title: Highly recommended play to stay !

reviews.text: We agree with kkyh's review from July 3rd. The hotel has a beautiful view, great pool and bar area. The rooms are clean and you can see the owner Anna's personal touch everywhere. You see her personal touch in all the small details of the appointments, flowers, vases, etc. Anna and her family really do make an incredible effort with the hotel. Jimmy, the bartender, is really friendly.
reviews.title: Nice but with strings attached

likes.liked: — The view and the pool area
likes.disliked: — Owner and staff are a little too emotional and controlling

reviews.text: The owner, however, is very controlling and if you don't follow the agenda she tries to set, you hear about it constantly. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, and so we also heard constant comments about us not being around. Our stay would have been a lot more relaxing without the comments and guilt tripping. It's a pity she's not more relaxed because the hotel, pool, and the view are all really nice. And to be fair, aside from the control issues, Anna and her family really make an effort for her guests to have a great experience.
reviews.title: one special lady

reviews.text: This is a great hotel to stay at if you like being treated like family and you like a lot of interaction and advice. I wouldn't stay here if you just like to do your own thing and go your own way.
reviews.title: A One of a Kind Hotel!

likes.liked: — The peronality of the hotel...the people that run the hotel and the people we met.

reviews.text: I am from Turkey . Being in Athens for business during a week in July 2007 , for the weekend I travelled via speedboat from Athens ( 3 hours) to Mykanos.Just made all the arrangements at very last minute and spent the weekend with late Friday arrival-Sunday Departure in Hotell Tagoo.
reviews.title: Awesome Place (Canadian Boys)

reviews.text: Being in Athens I just called a travel agency in Mykanos town and informed that there may be a room avaliable in Hotel Tagoo and then I checked Tripadvisor and find out that this place ranked at very top and it proved not to be wrong. By the way,be sure to make your arrangements not as I did very last minute. To be sure I had called the hotel myself and talked to Anna (the owner ) and decided to stay there andI never been dissapointed.
reviews.title: Tripadvisor ranking deserved

reviews.text: Hotel Tagoo felt like staying with family. The owners really take care of you.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They introduced us to people that we are still keeping in touch with now and made sure we were looked after all week.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay with AMAZING service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely and it's quiet.
reviews.title: Just paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool has such an amazing view and the staff are all lovely.
reviews.title: We never wanted to leave
Any thing you could ask for and more.
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Tagoo and we will be returning! The service was amazing from all staff members, Anna (the owner) was so helpful holding an 'information/ get to know you night' the first night with a free drink and gave us many suggestions and cost saving ideas and places to eat. They also held a greek night which was fantastic, especially the spinach pies she made and Yianni's Greek dancing. The pool here is amazing, the hotel is relatively close to town but we hired a quad and there was safe secure parking for it. We just loved it here!

Where does one start when trying to describe this gem?? We found this hotel here on Trip Advisor, and we were expecting a lot because of all the positive reviews, but we were blown away by everything about this hotel, and it staff. For starters, let point out, that if you are looking for a “luxury" hotel, with 5 star amenities and pampering, then look else where, Tagoo is not for you!
reviews.title: This is truly Greece at it's best!!

likes.liked: — The staff totally makes this hotel what it is, we have never encountered better!

reviews.text: However, if you are looking for a real slice of Greek living, and hospitality, then you will have found your nirvana here at Tagoo. The rooms are simple, and comfortable, they are kept impeccably clean, and have everything you will need to enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Good but not the best

reviews.text: Owner/Manager Anna (Mamma Tagoo) is about as close as you'll come to having a second mom, she is outgoing, friendly, a wealth of information about anything, and everything to do, eat or see on Myconos, or elsewhere in Greece, if you require, and she pulls it all off with a love for life that is contagious to all within distance of her. Her husband Yanni is your personal chauffeur to and from your port of entry, and can also be found dancing up a traditional Greek storm poolside with Anna. Speaking of the pool, it is the hub of this great hotel, Jimmy the bartender runs a smooth ship, with just the right blend of music, and drinks to keep you happy all day long, and he sets just the right atmosphere to relax in after a long day of touristing through the narrow streets of Myconos. This was our first stop before heading on to Santorini to get married, and we both agreed, that had we known how truly great Tagoo was, we would have planned to have been married here instead, without hesitation. 6 of us stayed and played at Tagoo, and we still talk about what a magical place Anna has created, and how sad we were to leave. We will be back to Myconos in the future, and we wouldn't dream of staying ANYWHERE but Hotel Tagoo. Thanks to you Anna and your wonderful staff for all you did to start our month in Greece, and our married life so perfectly.
reviews.title: Hotel Tagoo is a great reason to go back to Mykonos

likes.liked: — Hotel staff were friendly, helpful, and added to the wonderful experience of our Greek Island visit.
likes.disliked: — Only a couple of parking spaces at the hotel, but, staff gave us access to an area we could park just a minute's walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers
reviews.title: A truly wonderful small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave & Janelle
reviews.title: Our Favourite in all of Greece

description: Hotel Tagoo is a small family run complex of 20 rooms, of which some are standard or superior, with 2 single beds or double and queen size beds, some with common sea view terrace area, or private balconies, built on different level, in the cycladic architecture style. We have lovely swimming pool with one of the best views of the island, where you can enjoy great light lunches or great cocktails at our pool snack bar area, while enjoying the most breathtaking sunsets. Facilities include free parking, hairdryers, minifridges, kettles, adapters, irons, ironing boards, satelite tv channels, beach towels, free wifi, public pc for guests use.
